&#160;<br>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-
DECORATION: underline">EXHIBIT 31.2</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">CERTIFICATION OF</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL AND ACCOUNTING 
OFFICER</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">I, Salil Dhaumya, certify that:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">1. I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Pan
American Goldfields<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">&#160;</font>Ltd.;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any 
untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary 
to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such 
statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other 
financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material 
respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the 
registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this quarterly 
report;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">4. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are 
responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures 
(as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control 
over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-
15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">a) designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused 
such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its 
consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, 
particularly during the period in which this report is being 
prepared;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">b) designed such internal control over financial reporting, or 
caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our 
supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of 
financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external 
purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">c) evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s 
disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions 
about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end
of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; 
and&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">d) disclosed in this report any change in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">5. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have 
disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over 
financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee 
of registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the 
design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are 
reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, 
process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management
or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting.&#160;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">Date:&#160;&#160;July 20, 2012</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">/S/ Salil Dhaumya</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline">___________________________________</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">Salil Dhaumya</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">Chief Financial Officer</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

Roman">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the 
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, 
the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</font></div>

    <MXOM:BasisOfPresentationTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif"&gt;Pan&#13;American Goldfields Ltd. (formerly Mexoro Minerals, Ltd and 
Sunburst Acquisitions IV, Inc.) (&amp;#34;Panam&amp;#34; or the 
&amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;)&#13;was incorporated in the state of Delaware on 
March 23, 2010 and on July 2, 2010 changed its name to Pan American Goldfields 
Ltd.&#13;pursuant to an agreement and plan of merger between the Company and 
Mexoro Minerals Ltd. The Company was formed to seek out and&#13;acquire business
opportunities. Between 1997 and 2003, the Company was engaged in two business 
acquisitions and one business opportunity,&#13;none of which generated a 
significant profit or created sustainable business. All were sold or 
discontinued. The Company had previously&#13;been pursuing various business 
opportunities and, effective March 1, 2004, the Company changed its operations 
to mineral exploration.&#13;Currently, the main focus of the Company&amp;#146;s
operations is in Mexico and Argentina.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif"&gt;In&#13;February 2011, the Company entered into an agreement with 
Compa&amp;#241;ia Minera Alto Rio Salado S.A. (&amp;#147;Compa&amp;#241;ia 
Minera&amp;#148;),&#13;a private Argentine entity, for the acquisition of the 
15,000 hectares Cerro Delta Project in northwest La Rioja Province, 
Argentina.&#13;The agreement became effective in March 2011. Under the terms of 
the agreement, the Company is required to pay $150,000 upon signing&#13;(paid) 
the agreement, $200,000 on the first anniversary (the Company has paid $140,000 
of the $200,000 amount due and is negotiating&#13;the terms for the balance of 
the payment), $500,000 on the second anniversary, $750,000 on the third 
anniversary, $1.2 million&#13;on the fourth anniversary, and $2.2 million on the
fifth anniversary of the signing, with a final option payment of $5 
million&#13;to purchase a 100% interest in the Cerro Delta project payable on 
the sixth anniversary of the signing. The vendor will retain&#13;a 1% net 
smelter return (&amp;#147;NSR&amp;#148;) (note 
6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;On&#13;February 12, 2009, the
Company entered into a joint venture through a definitive agreement for 
development of its Cieneguita project&#13;with Minera Rio Tinto, S.A. de C.V. 
(&amp;#147;MRT&amp;#148;), a private company duly incorporated pursuant to the 
laws of Mexico. The&#13;purpose of the joint venture is to put the Cieneguita 
property into production. Pursuant to the agreement, MRT is to provide 
the&#13;necessary working capital to begin and maintain mining operations at 
Cieneguita, which are estimated to be $3,000,000. MRT plans&#13;to spend 100% of
the money to earn 74% of the net cash flow from production (notes 5 and 6). The 
Company will receive 20% of the&#13;net cash flows from 
production.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif"&gt;In&#13;September 2011, the Company executed an amended and restated 
development agreement for the restructure of its Cieneguita joint&#13;venture 
related to the Cieneguita project. Under the restructured joint venture 
agreement the Company receives 20% of the net&#13;operating profits after 
royalties for material processed through a small-scale pilot operation and mined
from the first 15 meters&#13;depth of the Cieneguita deposit until December 31, 
2012. For all other material processed from the property, the Company's 
interest&#13;is 80% and MRT is reduced to a 20% working interest, subject to 
certain dilution provisions (note 6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif"&gt;On&#13;May 25, 2004, the Company completed a &amp;#147;Share Exchange 
Agreement&amp;#148; with Sierra Minerals and Mining, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;Sierra&#13;Minerals&amp;#148;), a Nevada corporation, which caused 
Sierra Minerals to become a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. 
Sierra&#13;Minerals held certain rights to properties in Mexico that the Company
now owns or has an option to acquire. Through Sierra Minerals,&#13;the Company 
entered into a joint venture agreement with MRT. In August 2005, the Company 
cancelled the joint venture agreement&#13;in order to directly pursue mineral 
Exploration opportunities through a wholly-owned Mexican subsidiary, Sunburst 
Mining de Mexico&#13;S.A. de C.V. (&amp;#147;Sunburst de Mexico&amp;#148;). On 
August 25, 2005, the Company, Sunburst de Mexico and MRT entered into 
agreements&#13;providing Sunburst de Mexico the right to explore and exploit 
certain properties in Mexico. In December 2005, the Company and&#13;Sunburst de 
Mexico entered into a new agreement with MRT (the &amp;#147;New 
Agreement&amp;#148;) (note 6). On January 20, 2006, Sierra&#13;Minerals was 
dissolved.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</MXOM:BasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-
02to2012-05-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-
spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;
(a)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; Recent
accounting pronouncements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 12pt 1.5in; text-align: justify; text-
indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;
(i)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#1
60; On June 16, 2011, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update 
(&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) 2011-05, which revises the manner in which 
entities&#13;present comprehensive income in their financial statements. The new
guidance removes the presentation options in ASC 220 and requires&#13;entities 
to report components of comprehensive income in either (1) a continuous 
statement of comprehensive income or (2) two&#13;separate but consecutive 
statements. The ASU does not change the items that must be reported in other 
comprehensive income. The&#13;amendments are effective for fiscal years, and 
interim periods within those years, beginning after December 15, 2011. The 
Company&#13;does not expect the provisions of ASU 2011-05 to have a material 
effect on the financial position, results of operations or cash&#13;flows of the
Company, as the Company currently presents a continuous statement of operations 
and comprehensive income (loss).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 12pt 1.5in; text-
align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;
(ii)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; On 
May 12, 2011, the FASB issued ASU 2011-04. The ASU is the result of joint 
efforts by the FASB and IASB to develop a single,&#13;converged fair value 
framework. Thus, there are few differences between the ASU and its international
counterpart, IFRS 13. This&#13;ASU is largely consistent with existing fair 
value measurement principles in U.S. GAAP; however it expands ASC 820&amp;#146;s
existing&#13;disclosure requirements for fair value measurements and makes other
amendments. The ASU is effective for interim and annual periods&#13;beginning 
after December 15, 2011. The Company does not expect the provisions of ASU 2011-
05 to have a material effect on the&#13;financial position, results of 
operations or cash flows of the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 12pt 1.5in; text-
align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;
(iii)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; In 
May 2010, the FASB issued ASU 2010-19, Foreign Currency (Topic 830): Foreign 
Currency Issues: Multiple Foreign Currency Exchange&#13;Rates. The amendments in
this update are effective as of the announcement date of March 18, 2010. 
Implementation of ASU 2010-19&#13;did not have a material effect on the 
financial position, results of operations or cash flows of the 
Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 12pt 1.5in; text-align: justify; text-indent:
-0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;
(iv)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#
160;In April 2010, the FASB issued ASU 2010-17, Revenue Recognition-Milestone 
Method (Topic 605): Milestone Method of Revenue Recognition.&#13;The amendments 
in this update are effective on a prospective basis for milestones achieved in 
fiscal years, and interim periods&#13;within those years, beginning on or after 
June 15, 2010. Early adoption is permitted. If a vendor elects early adoption 
and the&#13;period of adoption is not the beginning of the entity&amp;#146;s 
fiscal year, the entity should apply the amendments retrospectively&#13;from the
beginning of the year of adoption. Implementation of ASU 2010-17 did not have a 
material effect on the financial position,&#13;results of operations or cash 
flows of the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:LiquidityDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align:
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The&#13;accompanying financial 
statements have been prepared on a going concern basis. The Company has a 
history of operating losses and&#13;will need to raise additional capital to 
fund its planned operations. As at May 31, 2012, the Company had a cumulative 
loss, during&#13;its exploration period, of $50,403,556 (February 29, 2012 - 
$49,701,810). These conditions raise substantial doubt about the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;ability to continue as a going 
concern.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The&#13;Company intends to 
reduce its cumulative loss through the attainment of profitable operations from 
its investment in Mexican and&#13;Argentine mining ventures (note 6). In 
addition, the Company has conducted private placements of common stock and 
convertible&#13;debt (note 10), which have generated a portion of the initial 
cash requirements for its planned mining ventures (note 
6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;May 2012, the Company converted subscription 
proceeds of $45,000 and issued 300,000 shares of common stock in a private 
placement.&#13;The subscribers to the subscription proceeds have agreed to 
purchase one unit for each $0.20 of subscription proceeds. Each 
unit&#13;consists of one share of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock and one 
warrant each exercisable at $0.30, which expires in two 
years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;February 2012, the Company completed a private
placement of 4,500,000 units at $0.20 per unit for total gross proceeds of 
$900,000.&#13;Each unit consisted of one share of common stock and one warrant 
to purchase one share of common stock, each exercisable at $0.30,&#13;expiring 
in two years from the closing date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;June 2011, the 
Company completed a private placement of 1,500,000 units at $0.20 per unit, for 
total proceeds of $300,000. Each&#13;unit consisted of one share of common stock
and one warrant to purchase one share of common stock, each exercisable at 
$0.30,&#13;expiring in two years from the closing 
date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;March 2011, the Company completed a private 
placement of 6,560,000 units at $0.20 per unit, for total proceeds of 
$1,312,000.&#13;Each unit consisted of one share of common stock and one warrant
to purchase one share of common stock. Each warrant is exercisable&#13;for one 
share of common stock at an exercise price of $0.30 per share for a period of 
two years from the closing date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;July 2009, the 
Company signed a definitive agreement to sell its Guazapares project located in 
southwest Chihuahua, Mexico to&#13;Paramount Gold de Mexico, SA de C.V., the 
Mexican subsidiary of Paramount Gold and Silver Corp. 
(&amp;#147;Paramount&amp;#148;) for a&#13;total consideration of up to 
$5,300,000. The purchase price is to be paid in two stages. The first payment of
$3,700,000 was released&#13;from escrow in February 2010, as the transfer of the
12 claims to Paramount was completed. An additional payment of $1,600,000&#13;is
due if, within 36 months following execution of the letter of agreement (July 
10, 2009), either (i) Paramount Gold de Mexico&#13;SA de C.V. is sold by 
Paramount, either through a stock sale or a sale of substantially all of its 
assets, or (ii) Paramount&amp;#146;s&#13;San Miguel project is put into 
commercial production.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:LiquidityDisclosureTextBlock>

13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</MXOM:EquipmentTextBlock>
    <MXOM:JointVentureWithMrtTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;On&#13;February 12, 2009, the 
Company entered into a joint venture through a definitive agreement for 
development of its Cieneguita project&#13;with MRT. The purpose of the joint 
venture is to put Cieneguita property into production. As per the agreement, MRT
is to provide&#13;the necessary working capital to begin and maintain mining 
operations estimated to be $3,000,000. MRT will spend 100% of the funds&#13;in 
exchange for a 75% interest in the net cash flow from production. The agreement 
was amended in December 2009 for MRT to earn&#13;a 74% interest in the net cash 
flow from production (note 6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;September 2011,
the Company executed an amended and restated development agreement for the 
restructure of its Cieneguita joint&#13;venture related to the Cieneguita 
project. Under the restructured joint venture agreement the Company receives 20%
of the net&#13;operating profits after royalties for material processed through 
a small-scale pilot operation and mined from the first 15 meters&#13;depth of 
the Cieneguita deposit until December 31, 2012. For all other material processed
from the property, the Company's interest&#13;is 80% and MRT is reduced to a 20%
working interest, subject to certain dilution provisions (note 
6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The&#13;agreement limits the mining of the 
mineralized material that is available from the surface to a depth of 15 meters 
or approximately&#13;10% of the mineralized material found as of the date of the
definitive agreement. The Company incurs no obligations to the 
joint&#13;venture&amp;#146;s creditors as the operations and working capital 
requirements are controlled by MRT and as such, the Company has&#13;concluded 
that it is not the primary beneficiary of the joint venture. Accordingly, the 
Company&amp;#146;s share of income and expenses&#13;are reflected in these 
financial statements under the proportionate consolidation 
method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#146;s 
proportionate share of revenues was $1,053,354 and proportionate share of the 
net profit was $592,048 for the three&#13;months ended May 31, 2012. The 
Company&amp;#146;s proportionate share of accounts receivable of the joint 
venture was $535,962 respectively,&#13;at May 31, 2012. The joint venture did 
not have any other assets or liabilities at May 31, 
2012.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</MXOM:JointVentureWithMrtTextBlock>

justify"&gt;The Company incurred exploration&#13;expenses as follows in the 
three months ended May 31, 2012:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0"

$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="border-bottom: windowtext

&lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-
align: left"&gt;General&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" 
style="padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;1,022&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" 
style="padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: right"&gt;-
&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-right: 
5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: right"&gt;1,022&lt;font style="color: 
black"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="background-color: White"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" 
style="border-bottom: windowtext 1.5pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; padding-
right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="border-
top: windowtext 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: windowtext 1.5pt solid; padding-
right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: right"&gt;19,326&lt;font 
style="color: black"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
nowrap="nowrap" style="border-top: windowtext 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: 
windowtext 1.5pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;36,067&lt;font style="color: 
black"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" 
style="border-top: windowtext 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: windowtext 1.5pt 
solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;55,393&lt;font style="color: 
black"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: bold 10pt Arial Bold; margin: 16pt 0 12pt; letter-spacing: 
-0.1pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Since May 2004, the Company has&#13;held interests in gold 
exploration properties in Mexico.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In August 2005, the Company formed&#13;its wholly owned subsidiary, 
Sunburst de Mexico, which allowed the Company to take title to the properties in
the name of Sunburst&#13;de Mexico. On August 25, 2005, the Company entered into
property agreements with MRT, which provided Sunburst de Mexico options&#13;to 
purchase the mineral concessions of the Cieneguita and Guazapares properties and
the right of refusal on three Encino Gordo&#13;properties. The Company also 
entered into an development and sale agreement, in October 2006, with Minera 
Emilio S.A. de C.V. for&#13;the mineral concessions of the Sahuayacan 
property.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2005, the 
parties also&#13;entered into an operator&amp;#146;s agreement, that gave MRT 
the sole and exclusive right and authority to manage the Cieneguita 
property,&#13;and a share option agreement which granted MRT the exclusive 
option to acquire up to 100% of all outstanding shares of Sunburst&#13;de Mexico
if the Company did not comply with the terms of the property agreements. The 
operator&amp;#146;s agreement and share option&#13;agreement were subsequently 
cancelled when the Company and Sunburst de Mexico entered into a new contract 
with MRT as described&#13;below under &amp;#147;Encino 
Gordo&amp;#148;.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2009, 
the Company&#13;entered into An Exploration agreement with MRT, which was 
amended in December 2009. Pursuant to the terms of the amended 
development&#13;agreement, MRT agreed to invest up to $8,000,000 to put the 
first phase of the Cieneguita project into production and complete&#13;a 
feasibility study. The first phase of production is limited to the mining of the
mineralized material that is available from&#13;the surface to a depth of 15 
meters (&amp;#147;First Phase Production&amp;#148;). In exchange, the Company 
assigned MRT an interest to&#13;74% of the net cash flows from First Phase 
Production and MRT would earn a 54% ownership interest by spending up to 
$4,000,000&#13;to take the Cieneguita project through the feasibility 
stage.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In September 2011, the 
Company&#13;executed an amended and restated development agreement for the 
restructure of its Cieneguita joint venture related to the 
Cieneguita&#13;project. Under the restructured joint venture agreement the 
Company receives 20% of the net operating profits after royalties&#13;for 
material processed through a small-scale pilot operation and mined from the 
first 15 meters depth of the Cieneguita deposit&#13;until December 31, 2012. For
all other material processed from the property, the Company's interest is 80% 
and MRT is reduced&#13;to a 20% working interest, subject to certain dilution 
provisions (note 6).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt
 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The material provisions of the&#13;property 
agreements are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: normal italic 
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 6pt 0; text-align: 
left"&gt;Cieneguita&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;MRT assigned to 
Sunburst de Mexico,&#13;with the permission of the Cieneguita 
property&amp;#146;s owner, Corporativo Minero, S.A. de C.V. 
(&amp;#147;Corporativo Minero&amp;#148;),&#13;all of MRT&amp;#146;s rights and 
obligations acquired under a previous agreement (the Cieneguita option 
agreement), including the&#13;exclusive option to acquire the Cieneguita 
property for a price of $2,000,000. Prior to assigning the Cieneguita property 
to the&#13;Company, MRT had paid $350,000 to Corporativo Minero. As the 
Cieneguita property was not in production by May 6, 2006, Sunburst&#13;de Mexico
was required to pay $120,000 to Corporativo Minero to extend the contract. 
Corporativo Minero agreed to reduce the obligation&#13;to $60,000, of which 
$10,000 was paid in April 2006 and the balance paid on May 6, 2006. The Company
made this payment to Corporativo&#13;Minero and the contract was 
extended.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company had the 
obligation&#13;to pay a further $120,000 per year for the next 13 years and the 
balance of the payments in the 14th year, until the total amount&#13;of 
$2,000,000 was paid. The Company renegotiated the payment due May 6, 2007, to 
$60,000 payable on November 6, 2007, which was&#13;paid, and the balance of 
$60,000 was paid on December 20, 2007. The Company paid $60,000 on May 12, 2008,
of the $120,000 due on&#13;May 6, 2008, and the balance was paid in June 2008. 
The Company paid $30,000 each for a total of $120,000 on May 22, 2009, 
June&#13;26, 2009, September 4, 2009 and November 20, 2009. In 2010, the 
Cieneguita project was put into production under the development&#13;agreement 
as described above and the payment terms were changed based on the following 
formula:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company must pay 
the Cieneguita&#13;owners $20 per ounce of gold produced from the Cieneguita 
property to the total of $2,000,000 due. In the event that the price&#13;of gold
is above $400 per ounce, the property payments payable to the Cieneguita owners 
from production will be increased by $0.10&#13;for each dollar increment over 
$400 per ounce. The total payment of $2,000,000 does not change with 
fluctuations in the price of&#13;gold. Non-payment of any portion of the 
$2,000,000 total payment will constitute a default. In such case, the Cieneguita
owners&#13;will retain ownership of the concessions, but the Company will not 
incur any additional default penalty.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In September 2011, the Company,&#13;MRT and Corporativo Minero 
entered into a new agreement, where Corporativo Minero is entitled to a monthly 
payment of $30,000,&#13;to be paid from the net cash flows from production at 
Cieneguita until the completion of the first 15 meters of production or 
December&#13;31, 2012, whichever occurs first.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;Based on production at Cieneguita,&#13;the joint venture paid
$90,000 during the three months ended May 31, 2012 (February 29, 2012 - 
$227,241) to the Cieneguita owners.&#13;As of May 31, 2012, Corporativo Minero 
has been paid a total of $1,267,241 for the Cieneguita property. The Company is 
not in&#13;default on its payments for the Cieneguita 
property.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 12, 2009, 
the Company&#13;entered into a definitive agreement for development of the 
Cieneguita project with MRT. The definitive agreement covered 
project&#13;financing of up to $9,000,000. The major points of the agreement 
were as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;
(i)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/font&gt;MRT and/or its investors will subscribe 
for $1,000,000 of a secured convertible debenture at 8% interest (payable in 
stock&#13;or cash). The debenture was convertible into units at $0.60 per unit. 
Each unit comprised two common shares and one warrant. Each&#13;warrant is 
exercisable at $0.50 per share for a period of three years. The placement will 
be used for continued development of&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s properties and 
general working capital.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
-0.5in"&gt;(ii)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/font&gt;MRT is to provide the necessary working capital to 
begin and maintain mining operations estimated to be $3,000,000 used&#13;for the
purpose of putting the Cieneguita property into production. MRT will spend 100% 
of the money to earn 75% of the net cash&#13;flow from production. The agreement
will limit the mining to the mineralized material that is available from surface
to a depth&#13;of 15 meters or approximately 10% of the mineralized material 
found to date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
-0.5in"&gt;(iii)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/
font&gt;MRT will spend up to $5,000,000 to take the Cieneguita property through 
the feasibility stage. In doing so, MRT will earn&#13;a 60% interest in the 
Company&amp;#146;s rights to the property. After the expenditure of the 
$5,000,000 all costs will be shared&#13;on a ratio of 60% to MRT and 40% to the 
Company. If the Company elects not to pay its portion of costs after the 
$5,000,000 has&#13;been spent, the Company&amp;#146;s position shall revert to a
25% carried interest on the property.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;To generate funding for the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;continued 
operations, the Company issued $1,500,000 of convertible debentures in March 
2009, of which an aggregate of $880,000&#13;was issued to Mario Ayub, a former 
director of the Company, and his affiliated entity, MRT. Pursuant to the terms 
of the convertible&#13;debentures, the holders irrevocably converted the 
debentures into a 10% ownership interest in the Cieneguita project and a 
10%&#13;interest in the net cash flow from First Phase 
Production.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In December 2009, Mario
Ayub&#13;and MRT agreed to resell an aggregate 4% ownership interest in the 
Cieneguita project back to the Company, along with 4% of the&#13;net cash flow 
from First Phase Production, in return for $550,000. In a private transaction 
not involving the Company, the other&#13;holders contributed their remaining 6% 
ownership interest in the Cieneguita project to a newly formed entity, Marje 
Minerals SA&#13;(&amp;#147;Marje Minerals&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;In December 2009, the Company&#13;amended the development 
agreement and its agreements with the debenture holders. According to the 
amended development agreement,&#13;the ownership interest in the Cieneguita 
project and the net cash flows from the First Phase Production were held by the 
Company,&#13;MRT and Marje Minerals as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 33%; 
vertical-align: top; border-top: windowtext 1.5pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; 
text-align: center; font-weight: bold"&gt;Holder&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 20%; vertical-align: top; border-top: windowtext 1.5pt solid; 
border-bottom: windowtext 0.25pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; text-align: 
center; font-weight: bold"&gt;Ownership Percentage&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td

First Phase Production&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 25%; vertical-

8pt"&gt;&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td

(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-

rgb(204,238,255)"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom; padding-

right"&gt;40%&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom; padding-
right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: right"&gt;20%&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt;
text-align: right"&gt;40%&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-
color: White"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: windowtext 1.5pt solid; 
vertical-align: bottom; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: 
windowtext 1.5pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: windowtext 
1.5pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; 
text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom:
windowtext 1.5pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-
left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 0 0.75in; text-
align: justify; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;(1) Was to&#13;be earned by MRT by 
spending $4,000,000 to take the Cieneguita project through the feasibility 
stage.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;Any 
additional costs for the&#13;First Phase Production and the feasibility study 
for the Cieneguita project, after MRT invested $8,000,000, would have been 
shared&#13;by the Company, MRT and Marje Minerals on a pro-rata basis based on 
their respective ownership percentages in the Cieneguita 
project.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The major terms of the 
amended&#13;development agreement with MRT and Marje Minerals were as 
follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;
(i)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/font&gt;MRT purchased $1,000,000 of secured 
convertible debentures at 8% interest (payable in stock or cash). The proceeds 
from&#13;this investment were used for continued development and exploration of 
the Cieneguita project and general working capital. On November&#13;5, 2009, MRT
exercised its conversion rights on the debenture and MRT was issued 3,333,333 
common shares and a warrant to purchase&#13;1,666,667 shares of common stock at 
an exercise price of $0.50 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
-0.5in"&gt;(ii)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/font&gt;MRT agreed to provide the necessary working capital 
to begin and maintain mining operations, estimated to be $3,000,000,&#13;to put 
the first phase of the Cieneguita project into production. In exchange for these
funds, the Company assigned MRT an interest&#13;to 74% of the net cash flow from
First Phase Production. The agreement limits the mining during First Phase 
Production to the mineralized&#13;material that is available from the surface to
a depth of 15 meters.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial,
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
-0.5in"&gt;(iii)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&#13;&lt;/
font&gt;MRT committed to spend up to $4,000,000 to take the Cieneguita project 
through the feasibility stage. In doing so, the Company&#13;assigned MRT a 54% 
interest in its rights to the Cieneguita project. After the expenditure of the 
$4,000,000, all costs will be&#13;shared on a pro rata ownership basis (i.e. 54%
to MRT, 40% to the Company and 6% to Marje Minerals). If any party cannot pay 
its&#13;portion of the costs after the $4,000,000 has been spent, then their 
ownership position in the Cieneguita project will be reduced&#13;by 1% for every
$100,000 invested by the other owners. The Company&amp;#146;s ownership interest
in the Cieneguita project, however,&#13;cannot be reduced below 25%. In 
addition, the Company has the right to cover Marje Minerals&amp;#146; pro rata 
portion of costs if&#13;they cannot pay their portion of the costs. In return, 
the Company will receive 1% of Marje Minerals&amp;#146; ownership 
position&#13;in the Cieneguita project for every $100,000 the Company invests on
their behalf.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
-0.5in"&gt;(iv)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The MRT agreement was contingent on the Company repaying its 
debenture to Paramount. In March 2009, the Company repaid $1,000,000,&#13;or 
approximately two-thirds of the debt, and Paramount released a security interest
it had on the Cieneguita project. In October&#13;2009, the Company repaid the 
remaining amount of the debt and Paramount released its security interests on 
the Sahuayacan, Guazapares&#13;and Encino Gordo 
properties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In 
September 2011, the Company&#13;executed a new amended and restated development 
agreement with MRT and Marje Minerals, for the restructure of its Cieneguita 
joint&#13;venture. Under the restructured joint venture agreement the Company 
receives 20% of the net operating profits after royalties for&#13;material 
processed through a small-scale pilot operation and mined from the first 15 
meters depth of the Cieneguita deposit until&#13;December 31, 2012. For all 
other material processed from the property, the Company's interest is 80% and 
MRT is reduced to a 20%&#13;working interest, subject to certain dilution 
provisions. The Company also bought back 6% interest in Cieneguita from Marje 
Minerals&#13;in exchange for 3,333,333 common shares of the 
Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: bold 10pt Arial Bold; margin: 
16pt 0 12pt; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;Under 
the agreement, the parties&#13;agreed to restructure their respective ownership 
interests in the Cieneguita project as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,

padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
right"&gt;80%&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: 
White"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: windowtext 1.5pt solid;

windowtext 1.5pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-

right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
Company and MRT shall be&#13;responsible for the cost of a feasibility study on 
a pro rata basis based on their respective amended ownership percentages 
of&#13;the Cieneguita project.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial,
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;Marje 
Minerals will also assume&#13;approximately $490,000 in debt of the Company in 
consideration for receiving half of all monthly net cash flows that the 
Company&#13;is entitled from operations on the first 15 meters, if any, until 
the sooner of December 31, 2012 or until Marje Minerals receives&#13;$490,000 
from these cash flows (note 7).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: normal 
italic 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 6pt 0; text-align: 
left"&gt;Encino Gordo&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;On 
December 8, 2005, the Company&#13;and Sunburst de Mexico entered into a 
&amp;#147;New Agreement&amp;#148; with MRT to exercise their option under the 
sale and purchase&#13;of the mining concessions agreement, dated August 18, 
2005, to obtain two mining concessions in the Encino Gordo region. The 
New&#13;Agreement also provided the Company the option to obtain three 
additional concessions in the Encino Gordo region.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;The following are additional&#13;material terms of the New 
Agreement:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify; text-
indent: -0.5in"&gt;(a)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The share option agreement with MRT was 
cancelled;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;(b)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, 
Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The Company granted MRT the option to buy all of the 
outstanding shares of Sunburst de Mexico for $100 if the Company failed&#13;to 
transfer $1,500,000 to Sunburst de Mexico by April 30, 2006. On April 6, 2006, 
MRT agreed to waive its option to purchase the&#13;shares of Sunburst de Mexico 
and also waived the Company&amp;#146;s obligation to transfer $1,500,000 to 
Sunburst de Mexico. The property&#13;agreements were modified to change the NSR 
to a maximum of 2.5% for all properties covered by the agreements. The property 
agreements&#13;contained NSRs ranging from 0.5% to 7%;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-
spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-
spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;(c)&lt;font 
style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The Company agreed to issue 2,000,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock to MRT within four months of the date 
of&#13;signing of the New Agreement. These shares were issued to MRT and its 
assignee at the market value of $1.05 per share on February&#13;23, 2006, and 
$2,100,000 was charged to operations for the year ended February 28, 2006. This 
issuance fulfilled the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;payment obligations under the 
previous property agreements;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;(d)&lt;font style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, 
Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The Company agreed to issue 1,000,000 additional shares of the
Company&amp;#146;s common stock to MRT if and when the Cieneguita&#13;property 
is put into production and reaches 85% of production capacity over a 90-day 
period, as defined in the New Agreement; and&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-
spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-
spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;(e)&lt;font 
style="font: 7pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&#13;&lt;/font&gt;The operator&amp;#146;s agreement with MRT was 
cancelled.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Sunburst de Mexico purchased&#13;two of the Encino Gordo concessions
from MRT for a price of 1,000 pesos (approximately US$100), and MRT assigned to 
Sunburst de&#13;Mexico a first right of refusal to acquire three additional 
Encino Gordo concessions. The total payments to acquire 100% of these&#13;three 
additional concessions were as follows: $10,000 on June 30, 2006 (paid); $25,000
on December 31, 2006 (paid), $50,000 on&#13;December 31, 2007 ($20,000 of this 
payment was made on January 3, 2008 and the balance was paid on February 29, 
2008) and $75,000&#13;on December 31, 2008 (the payment was not made and the 
Company was in default). In August 2009, the Company decided to 
surrender&#13;the Encino Gordo 2 mining concession eliminating any future
concession payments on these properties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
 style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;In May 2012, the Company transferred&#13;its interest in 
concessions at the Encino Gordo project located in the Barranca region of 
Chihuahua State in Mexico, which included&#13;two concessions owned by the 
Company and two additional concessions the Company had the option to acquire, to
MRT. In connection&#13;with the transfer, MRT paid $100,000 cash, waived 
$200,000 in payments the Company owed to MRT in connection with the Encino 
Gordo&#13;Project and agreed to assume all of the Company&amp;#146;s obligations
related to the transferred concessions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
normal italic 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 6pt 0; text-align: 
left"&gt;Cerro Delta&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In 
February 2011, the Company&#13;management entered into an agreement with 
Compania Minera Alto Rio Salado S.A., a private Argentine entity, for the 
acquisition&#13;of the 15,000 hectare Cerro Delta project in northwest La Rioja 
Province, Argentina. Under the terms of the agreement, the Company&#13;must pay 
$150,000 upon signing (paid), and $200,000 on the first anniversary (the Company
has paid $140,000 of the $200,000 amount&#13;due and is negotiating the terms 
for the balance of the payments), $500,000 on the second anniversary, $750,000 
on the third anniversary,&#13;$1.2 million on the fourth anniversary, and $2.2 
million on the fifth anniversary of the signing, with a final option payment 
of&#13;$5 million to purchase a 100% interest in the project payable on the 
sixth anniversary of the signing. The vendor will retain a&#13;1% NSR (note 
17).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</MXOM:MineralPropertiesTextBlock>
    <MXOM:PromissoryNotesTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-31">&lt;p
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;As&#13;at May 31, 2012, the 
Company had $nil (February 29, 2012 - $nil) of promissory notes outstanding, 
comprising the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;(a)&lt;font style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;During the year ended 
February 29, 2008, the Company converted accounts payable of $465,994 (Swiss 
Franc (&amp;#147;CHF&amp;#148;)&#13;565,000) into promissory notes. The Company 
had an implied obligation to pay the accounts payable in CHF as the funds to pay
the&#13;expense came from Swiss investors in CHF. Accordingly, the promissory 
notes were issued in CHF. The notes consisted of one warrant&#13;for each CHF 
5.00 of notes issued, exercisable at $1.00 each. The principal and interest on 
the notes became due and payable on&#13;April 30, 2008. The interest rate 
payable during the default period was 12%. In September 2011, the Company 
executed debt conversion&#13;and release agreements to convert promissory notes 
and related interest charges in the amount of $1,091,645 into 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common shares for a total of 3,340,880 shares (note 
10).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, 
Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-spacing: -0.1pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt

align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;
(b)&lt;font style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;During the year ended February 29, 
2012, the Company entered into an agreement to convert $17,778 of the promissory
notes&#13;including accrued interest by issuing 55,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock (note 10).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0 0 0 1in; letter-

(c)&lt;font style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;$10,358 of 
promissory notes were to be repaid over a 12 month period as part of a debt 
settlement agreement. These notes&#13;bore no interest. In September 2011, the 
Company assigned these notes to Marje Minerals as part of the amended and

6).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,

31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt 0pt 0pt 22pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;The Company is authorized to 
issue 20,000,000&#13;shares of preferred stock. The Company&amp;#146;s board of 
directors is authorized to divide the preferred stock into series, and&#13;with 
respect to each series, to determine the preferences and rights and 
qualifications, limitations or restrictions thereof,&#13;including the dividend 
rights, conversion rights, voting rights, redemption rights and terms, 
liquidation preferences, sinking&#13;fund provisions, and the number of shares 
constituting the series and the designations of such series. The board of 
directors&#13;could, without stockholder approval, issue preferred stock with 
voting and other rights that could adversely affect the voting&#13;rights of the
holders of common stock, which issuance could have certain anti-takeover 
effects. There were no shares of preferred&#13;stock issued or outstanding at 
May 31, 2012 or February 29, 2012.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-

    <MXOM:CommonStockTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-31">&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 
2012, the Company converted&#13;subscription proceeds of $45,000 and issued 
300,000 shares of common stock in a private placement. The subscribers to the 
subscription&#13;proceeds have agreed to purchase one unit for each $0.20 of 
subscription proceeds. Each unit consists of one share of the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock and two warrants each exercisable at $0.20 
and $0.30, which expire in two years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In April 2012, the Company issued&#13;235,294 common shares pursuant
to a debt settlement agreement to settle $40,000 of debt. The shares were valued
at the time of&#13;issuance at $0.17 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;In April 2012, the Company issued&#13;250,000 common shares 
to a consultant pursuant to a consulting agreement. The shares were valued at
the time of issuance at $0.18&#13;per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;In February 2012, the Company&#13;issued 500,000 shares of 
common stock and warrants to purchase 500,000 shares of common stock at $0.30, 
expiring on February 29,&#13;2014, to a consultant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;Between September 2011 and February&#13;2012, the Company 
converted subscription proceeds of $900,000 and issued 4,500,000 shares of 
common stock in a private placement.&#13;The subscribers to the subscription 
proceeds have agreed to purchase one unit for each $0.20 of subscription 
proceeds. Each unit&#13;consists of one share of the Company&amp;#146;s common 
stock and one warrant each exercisable at $0.30, which expires in two 
years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In December 2011, the 
Company&#13;acquired 6% ownership interest in the Cieneguita project in exchange
for 3,333,333 common shares, of which, the Company had issued&#13;1,166,667 
common shares as of February 29, 2012.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In October 2011, the Company&#13;and note holders agreed to cancel 
$979,476 of outstanding debt in exchange for 3,340,880 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common shares.&#13;The Company recognized a gain on 
settlement of debt in the amount of $277,891. In November 2011, the Company also
issued 267,271&#13;shares to a consultant as consulting fee relating to the 
settlement of debt.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2011, 
the Company negotiated&#13;return of 750,000 shares to the treasury from a 
former president. The shares were valued at the time of issuance at $0.28 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In July 2011, the Company 
issued&#13;500,000 shares of common stock and warrants to purchase 500,000 
shares of common stock at $0.30, expiring on July 21, 2013, to&#13;a 
consultant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2011, the 
Company converted&#13;subscription proceeds of $300,000 and issued 1,500,000 
shares of common stock in a private placement. The subscribers to the 
subscription&#13;proceeds have agreed to purchase one unit for each $0.20 of 
subscription proceeds. Each unit consists of one share of the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock and one warrant each exercisable at $0.30, 
which expires in two years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In June
2011, the Company issued&#13;125,000 shares to a consultant pursuant to a 
consulting agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In June
2011, the Company issued&#13;the 423,752 shares pursuant to the April 2011 debt 
settlement agreement. The shares were valued at the time of the debt 
settlement&#13;agreement of $0.28 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;In April 2011, the Company converted&#13;subscription 
proceeds of $347,000 and issued 1,735,000 shares of common stock in a private 
placement. The subscribers to the subscription&#13;proceeds have agreed to 
purchase one unit for each $0.20 of subscription proceeds. Each unit consists of

exercisable at $0.30, which expires in two years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p

align: justify"&gt;In March 2011, the Company converted&#13;subscription 
proceeds of $665,000 and issued 3,325,000 shares of common stock in a private 
placement. The subscribers to the subscription&#13;proceeds have agreed to 
purchase one unit for each $0.20 of subscription proceeds. Each unit consists of
one share of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock and one warrant each

    <MXOM:StockCompensationProgramTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;On&#13;March 18, 2009, the board
of directors approved the granting of stock options according to the 2009 
Nonqualified Stock Option&#13;Plan (&amp;#147;2009 Option Plan&amp;#148;) 
whereby the board is authorized to grant to employees and other related persons 
stock options&#13;to purchase an aggregate of up to 6,000,000 shares of the 
Company's common stock. Subject to the adoption of the 2009 Option Plan,&#13;the
options were granted and vest, pursuant to the terms of the 2009 Option Plan, in
six equal instalments, with the first instalment&#13;vesting at the date of 
grant, and the balance vesting over 2.5 years, every six 
months.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;In&#13;the three months ended 
May 31, 2012, the Company awarded nil options to purchase common shares (May 31,
2011 &amp;#150; 1,600,000)&#13;and recorded stock-based compensation expense for
the vesting options of $86,600 (May 31, 2011- $146,175). The following 
weighted&#13;average assumptions were used for the Black-Scholes option-pricing 
model to value stock options granted in 2012 and 
2011:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: 
collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 52%; vertical-align: bottom; border-top: 
windowtext 1.5pt solid; border-bottom: windowtext 0.25pt solid; padding-right: 
5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 22%; 
vertical-align: bottom; border-top: windowtext 1.5pt solid; border-bottom: 
windowtext 0.25pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;
&lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 3%; border-top: windowtext 1.5pt solid; 
border-bottom: windowtext 0.25pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 
5.4pt; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 23%; 
vertical-align: bottom; border-top: windowtext 1.5pt solid; border-bottom: 
windowtext 0.25pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:

0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;As&#13;of May 31, 2012, there 
was an estimated $291,000 of total unrecognized compensation cost related to 
non-vested share-based compensation&#13;arrangements granted under the 2009 
nonqualified stock option plan. That cost is expected to be recognized over a 
weighted-average&#13;period of approximately 1.30 
years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica,
Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;On&#13;April 29, 2011, the Company repriced the 
exercise price of 1,125,000 vested stock options by reducing the exercise prices
of $0.36&#13;and $0.44 to $0.28. As a result, the Company recorded incremental 
stock-based compensation of $6,000 during the year ended February&#13;29, 
2012.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</MXOM:StockCompensationProgramTextBlock>
    <MXOM:WarrantsTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-31">&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;As at 
May 31, 2012, the Company&#13;had a total of 32,709,567 warrants (February 29, 
2012 &amp;#150; 32,011,733) outstanding to purchase common stock. Each warrant 
entitles&#13;the holder to purchase one share of the Company&amp;#146;s common 
stock. The Company has reserved 32,709,567 shares of common stock&#13;in the 
event that these warrants are exercised.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;During the three months ended&#13;May 31, 2012, the Company received
$nil from warrants exercised.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, 
Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The

a director.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-

directors and officers of the Company and $nil (May 31, 2011 - $1,826)&#13;was 
owing to a company controlled by a director. In addition, promissory notes of 
$nil (May 31, 2011 - $11,130) were owed to a&#13;company controlled by a 
director.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-

    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2012-03-02to2012-05-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In June 2012, the Company issued&#13;194,444 common shares pursuant 
to a debt settlement agreement to settle $20,000 of debt. The shares were valued
at the time of&#13;issuance at $0.10 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;On July 13, 2012, the Company&#13;completed a $2.1 million 
private placement offering (the &amp;#147;Offering&amp;#148;). In the Offering, 
the Company issued 17,500,000&#13;shares of its common stock at a subscription 
price of $0.12 per share. Of the aggregate purchase price, $1,050,000 was paid 
in&#13;cash and $1,050,000 was paid through the transfer of real property in 
Argentina valued at $1,050,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company intends to liquidate&#13;the real property it acquired 
as soon as practical. The Company intends to use the net proceeds from the 
Offering for working capital&#13;and general corporate purposes, including 
supporting the scoping study for its Cieneguita Project in Mexico and the 
exploration&#13;program for its Cerro Delta Project in 
Argentina.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company paid a 
finder&amp;#146;s&#13;fee of $84,000 and 700,000 shares of common 
stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 3pt 0 6pt 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 16, 2012, the Board 
of&#13;Directors of the Company approved the conversion of outstanding fees in 
the amount of $51,900 owed to the Company&amp;#146;s directors&#13;into shares 
of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock, at a conversion price of $0.10 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
